title.narrative: Regional Sahel Pastoralism Support Project II

description.narrative: To improve the resilience of pastoralists and agro-pastoralists in selected areas in the Sahel region.

Republic of Senegal, Ministry of Livestock and Animal Production

condition.narrative: Burkina Faso: Section I.A.1(b)(ii)(A) of Schedule 2 of the Financing Agreement: The Recipient shall, not later than two (2) monthsafter the Effective Date, appoint and thereafter maintain, at all times during the implementation of the Project, NPCU withadequatestaff, including, inter alia: a project manager, an administrative and financial specialist, a procurement specialist, aninternal auditor, a monitoring and evaluation specialists, a communication specialist, an environmental specialist, a socialdevelopment and gender based violence specialist, and technical specialists for the oversight of Parts 1, 2, 3 and 4 of theProject, all recruited on the basis of terms of reference, qualifications, integrity and experience acceptable to the Association.

Burkina Faso: Section I.A.1(b)(ii)(B) of Schedule 2 of the Financing Agreement: The Recipient shall, not later than six (6) monthsafter the Effective Date, appoint an external auditor for the Project, in accordance with the provisions of the ProcurementRegulations.

Burkina Faso: Section I.A.1(b)(ii)(C) of Schedule 2 of the Financing Agreement: The Recipient shall, not later than five (5) monthsafter the Effective Date, reconfigure its computerized accounting system with technical specifications satisfactory to theAssociation.

Burkina Faso: Section I.B.2(a) of Schedule 2 of the Financing Agreement: The Recipient shall prepare and furnish to the Associationnot later than November 30, of each Fiscal Year during the implementation of the Project, a work plan and budget containing allactivities proposed to be included in the Project during the following Fiscal Year.

CILSS: Section I.A.1(b)(ii)(A) of Schedule 2 of the Financing Agreement: The Recipient shall, not later than three (3) months afterthe Effective Date, maintain at all times during the implementation of the Project and recruit when applicable, key staffincluding, a coordinator, a procurement specialist, a financial management specialist, a gender-based violence expert, a monitoringand evaluation specialist, a communication specialist and technical experts, all with qualifications, experience and under terms ofreference satisfactory to the Association.

CILSS: Section I.A.1(b)(ii)(B) of Schedule 2 of the Financing Agreement: The Recipient shall, not later than six (6) months afterthe Effective Date, appoint an external auditor for the Project, in accordance with the provisions of the Procurement Regulations.

CILSS: Section I.A.1(b)(ii)(C) of Schedule 2 of the Financing Agreement: The Recipient shall, not later than two (2) months afterthe Effective Date, update the terms of reference of its internal auditor to include the audit of activities under the Project, allin accordance with the provisions of the PIM.

CILSS: Section I.A.1(b)(ii)(D) of Schedule 2 of the Financing Agreement: The Recipient shall, not later than five (5) months afterthe Effective Date, acquire and install a computerized accounting system with technical specifications satisfactory to theAssociation.

Chad: Section I.A.1(b)(ii)(B) of Schedule 2 of the Financing Agreement: The Recipient shall, not later than six (6) months afterthe Effective Date, appoint an external auditor for the Project, in accordance with the provisions of the Procurement Regulations.

Chad: Section I.A.1(b)(ii)(C) of Schedule 2 of the Financing Agreement: The Recipient shall, not later than five (5) months afterthe Effective Date, acquire and install a computerized accounting system with technical specifications satisfactory to theAssociation.

Mali: Section I.A.1(b)(ii)(B) of Schedule 2 of the Financing Agreement: The Recipient shall, not later than three (3) months afterthe Effective Date, appoint and recruit a procurement assistant and two monitoring and evaluation assistants.

Mali: Section I.A.1(b)(ii)(C) of Schedule 2 of the Financing Agreement: The Recipient shall, not later than six (6) months afterthe Effective Date, appoint an external auditor for the Project, in accordance with the provisions of the Procurement Regulations.

Mali: Section I.A.1(b)(ii)(D) of Schedule 2 of the Financing Agreement: The Recipient shall, not later than five (5) months afterthe Effective Date, acquire and install a computerized accounting system with technical specifications satisfactory to theAssociation.

Mauritania: Section I.A.1(b)(ii)(A) of Schedule 2 of the Financing Agreement: The Recipient shall, not later than three (3) monthsafter the Effective Date, appoint and thereafter maintain, at all times during the implementation of the Project, NPCU staff withqualifications and under terms of reference satisfactory to the Association, including: a Project coordinator, a technicaldirector, a procurement specialist, financial management specialist, environmental safeguards specialist, social developmentspecialist, a gender and gender-based-violence specialist, a communications specialist, and technical experts for Parts 1, 2, 3,and 4.

Mauritania: Section I.A.1(b)(ii)(B) of Schedule 2 of the Financing Agreement: The Recipient shall, not later than six (6) monthsafter the Effective Date, appoint an external auditor for the Project, in accordance with the provisions of the ProcurementRegulations.

Mauritania: Section I.A.1(b)(ii)(C) of Schedule 2 of the Financing Agreement: The Recipient shall, not later than five (5) monthsafter the Effective Date, acquire and install a computerized accounting system with technical specifications satisfactory to theAssociation.

Niger: Section I.A.1(b)(ii)(A) of Schedule 2 of the Financing Agreement: The Recipient shall, not later than three (3) months afterthe Effective Date, appoint and thereafter maintain, at all times during the implementation of the Project, additional NPCU staffas required with qualifications and under terms of reference satisfactory to the Association.

Niger: Section I.A.1(b)(ii)(B) of Schedule 2 of the Financing Agreement: The Recipient shall, not later than six (6) months afterthe Effective Date, appoint an external auditor and an internal auditor for the Project, in accordance with the provisions of theProcurement Regulations.

Niger: Section I.A.1(b)(ii)(C) of Schedule 2 of the Financing Agreement: The Recipient shall, not later than five (5) months afterthe Effective Date, acquire and install a computerized accounting system with technical specifications satisfactory to theAssociation.

Senegal: Section I.A.1(b)(ii)(A) of Schedule 2 of the Financing Agreement: The Recipient shall, not later than six (6) months afterthe Effective Date, appoint an external auditor for the Project, in accordance with the provisions of the Procurement Regulations.

Senegal: Section I.A.1(b)(ii)(B) of Schedule 2 of the Financing Agreement: The Recipient shall, not later than five (5) monthsafter the Effective Date, acquire and install a computerized accounting system with technical specifications satisfactory to theAssociation.

title.narrative: Cultivated fodder produced and available to pastoralists and agro-pastoralists thanks to the Project - Regional level
Pastoralists and agropastoralists having obtained a civil status document or a registration in the social registry thanks to the Project
Income increase of pastoral households generated with the support of the Project - Regional level
Trade barriers monitored on selected cross-border marketing areas and disseminated by the Project
Reduction rate of conflicts linked to mobile livestock systems in three transhumance and trade axes (West, Center, and East) in theSahel and West Africa
Bilateral and multilateral agreements facilitating a peaceful transhumance established thanks to the Project
Regional capacity strengthened to conduct prospective analyzes on the livestock sector
Countries and regional institutional capacity built for climate-informed livestock policies and strategies
Management committees with at least 15% of women actively participating
Inspections dedicated to the control of veterinary medicines implemented through the Project
Implementation rate of action plans developed by umbrella pastoral organizations (part supported by the Project) - Regional level
Women having received financial literacy training
Direct beneficiaries of innovative sub-projects to valorize pastoral value chains promoted by the Project
Women and youth in the pastoral sector who have benefited from technical and vocational training programs or skills training programs
Number of small ruminants vaccinated and marked against PPR - Regional level
Technical and scientific executives trained in pastoralism (including diploma courses)
Veterinary units built or rehabilitated by the Project and functional in the targeted areas - Regional level
Functional committees for the sustainable management of landscapes facilitating mobility established or supported by the Project - Regional level
Farmers having benefited from agricultural assets or services - Regional level
Functional water points accessible to (agro)pastoralists on livestock mobility routes and on new transhumance routes supported by the Project - Regional level
Direct beneficiaries of income-generating activities promoted by the Project
Vaccination pens built or rehabilitated by the Project in the targeted areas - Regional level
Vaccination coverage rate for CBPP - Regional level
Level of implementation of the National Strategic Plans (NSPs) for PPR and CBPP
Percentage of grievances addressed in line with timelines and protocols established
Land area under sustainable landscape management practices
Operational markets according to defined criteria rehabilitated and built on regional routes thanks to the Project - Regional level
Pastoralism-specific parameters sustained in the national early warning system
